intro: Erigeron nigrimontanus, commonly known as black mountain fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Erigeron nigrimontanus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
